intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Whoaaa... I don't think I've ever felt so small...

intro.speaker: Basilio
intro.line: I can't even see the top of it!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Most impressive indeed... So the shrine hides all the way up in its branches?

intro.speaker: Say'Ri
intro.line: Aye, sir. A great staircase inside the trunk leads up to it. However, the empire has closed off the only route to the steps. Or perhaps "roots" to the steps, I should say.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Then we'll just have to break through. Come!

battle.speaker: Cervantes
battle.line: So! They arrive at last, eh wot! "Yes, come closer," said the hairy spider to the flies...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: General Cervantes! Lord Excellus was right—the Ylissean League approaches!

battle.speaker: Cervantes
battle.line: ...Are you daft, boy? Did you not hear what I was JUST saying?!

battle.speaker: Cervantes
battle.line: Hmm... They must have some skill to make it this far... But no matter. We will show them the meaning of the word "fear"...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: The meaning of "beard," sir? Er, yes, I'm sure they would be most impressed.... But perhaps—

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Y-yes, sir! Of course, sir! ...Sorry, sir!

battle.speaker: Cervantes
battle.line: ...They are impressive, though, aren't they? My whiskers? Ha ha! I've not shaved since my very first battle. And have I ever lost? No! Not even once! Ergo, my moustache makes me invincible. It's science, my boy—science!

battle.speaker: Cervantes
battle.line: Heh ha, yes! "Come, reinforcements," said the spider to...the...other spiders.

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: My whiskers are safe against you lot—victory is inevitable!

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: Nngah! But...how can this be? My invincible moustache! Blasted science, you have...played me for a...fool...

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: Fiend! You invade kingdoms and bully them into submission... Why? What does it achieve?

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: Do you even need ask, whelp? Emperor Walhart is destined to rule this world, plain and simple.

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: Irrelevant! Walhart's mind is beyond the grasp of common men.

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: So you don't even know what you're fighting for?

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: I tend to my own beard, boy. A soldier does not question orders. But he gives his loyalty—and maybe his life—in the service of greater men.

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: Great men? Is living only to conquer so great an ambition?

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: What could be greater! Once I had dreams myself of commanding a nation... But Walhart? Aye, he dreams bigger. He would rule the entire world! Mine is nothing compared to the moxie of the Conqueror. I am but a single tiny hair on the beard of a flea in his great moustache! Have you not tasted the thrill of being part of something bigger than yourself?

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: Not at the price of inflicting cruelty and suffering, no.

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: Hmph. Then we have nothing more to discuss. Prepare to learn the meaning of the word "beard." ...Fear, I mean fear!

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: ...Eh wot?! It cannot be! Say'ri—my mortal enemy...

boss.speaker: Say'Ri
boss.line: General Cervantes... Your reputation—and your gut—precedes you.

boss.speaker: Cervantes
boss.line: But we have met in battle before, girl! Have you forgotten?! Not long ago, you and I, locked in deadly combat. I was sure we had won the day until you appeared...

boss.speaker: Say'Ri
boss.line: ...Your beard again? Can you talk of nothing else, you imperial pig?!

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Marry! What fighting! I almost pity the enemies of Ylisse.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Say'ri, do you know the way up to the shrine?

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Aye, sir. Follow me—and let us be quick about it!

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: *Huff huff* Ugh... How many stairs are there in a case of stairs? Because I'm already sick of this stupid staircase!

end.speaker: Lucina
end.line: The Voice truly lives all the way up here?

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Lady Tiki! Are you here? Prithee answer!

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: *Yawn*

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Ah, my lady... I'm so relieved to see you're all right.

end.speaker: Lucina
end.line: So you are Lady Tiki? She who speaks for the divine dragon?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: ...Marth? Oh, Mar-Mar, is that you?!

end.speaker: Lucina
end.line: ...My name is Lucina, milady. Though I did go by the name Marth for a time. Might we have met?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: ...Alas, no. I'm sorry... You reminded me of someone I knew. But he is gone now. Lost during my endless sleep...

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: You and your father are of the exalted bloodline, are you not?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Yes, milady.

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Do you yet possess the Fire Emblem? It should have been passed down through your family...

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: I... Yes, I have it...

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Ah! What relief to know it has not been lost. ...But where are the Gemstones? I see only Argent.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Gemstones?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Yes, there are five of them—Argent, Sable, Gules, Azure, and Vert. Each holds a portion of Naga's power. When mounted upon the Emblem, they allow one to perform the Awakening.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The rite by which the first exalt channeled the divine dragon's power...

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: The very same. With the Fire Emblem's power, the exalt was able to defeat Grima. But such power was too much for men, and so the Gemstones were scattered. I kept Azure here with me.

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: My kingdom had safeguarded Vert for generations. But the gem was recently stolen by Walhart's men.

end.speaker: Lucina
end.line: Milady, do you know where the other two Gemstones might be?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: The remaining Gemstones, Sable and Gules, are no longer known to me. They may have been taken long ago, at the time of the Schism.

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Regna Ferox was founded during the Schism. As were most all nations in the realm, I believe.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Wait—does that mean you guys have one of the Gemstones, Basilio?

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Ha! As if anyone would entrust the oaf with such a thing!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Actually, it's true—we did keep one: Gules. ...Did I never inform you?

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: You most certainly did not.

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Hmm... Must have slipped my mind. Regardless, yes. The West-Khans once safeguarded Gules. But it was lost long before my lifetime.

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Here. Take Azure, exalted ones. With it, you possess two of the five Gemstones. Now you must seek out the others and perform the Awakening. Our world must be defended from Grima at all costs!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: But I'm confused... I thought Grima's power was sealed away.

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Yes, but ever since, there have been those who would change that. Grima's life force grows even now, and with it, the long shadows of despair.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: When will he return? And where?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: I cannot know these things. But I can feel his presence... It looms, closer and closer... This task is a heavy burden, but as he of exalted blood, it must fall to you, Chrom.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: I understand. Thank you, for all your help.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: We owe you a great debt, milady.

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: Ah! You... You have it...

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: ...What?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: You have power...like mine.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: I do?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: I... Ah... Forgive me... I am still groggy from my slumber. My words outpace my thoughts.

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Are you all right, my lady?

end.speaker: Tiki
end.line: I am fine... Just very tired... I haven't the strength to join you in the fray. Not yet. But I will call the people together, in prayer, for an end to this conflict.

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Factions of the Resistance are already uniting in answer to the Voice's call! Soon bards will sing of this day... "They who conquered the Conqueror!"

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: A tune I'm most anxious to hear.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: But a man like Walhart will not roll over dead at the first sign of trouble...

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Aye, my lord...as you say. He will muster his forces to put down the Rebellion. Then his gaze will turn to us. Against his full might, we would not last long.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Where are his armies garrisoned?

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: The Valmese Imperial Army is comprised of three main divisions: one controls the north, one the south, and the third the lands between. Emperor Walhart commands the northern forces. Their might easily exceeds our own. The south is led by my brother, Yen'fay. His host is said to rival Walhart's.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Divisions, are they? Hmm...

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: I see a plan brewing in those eyes of yours, Robin...

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: If we could divide their divisions—disrupt communications, supplies, et cetera... Then introduce misinformation to add to the confusion...a whisper here and there... The panic would spread on its own...and all the quicker for their great number. Such a giant force could collapse under its own weight.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Say'ri—the third division, stationed between the other two...

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Aye, sir, at Fort Steiger, halfway along the highroad. In fact, not so far from where we stand now. We might stand a chance against them... But it would take speed, and luck. I wager Walhart and Yen'fay will hear of our exploits soon, if they haven't already. I suggest sending the bulk of our army to the north and south to mask our plan. An elite force, led by Sir Chrom, might then quietly slip through to Fort Steiger. What say you?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: I say, "aye."

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Aye.

end.speaker: Say'Ri
end.line: Fie! We could all be dead before nightfall, yet not one of you so much as hesitates. Your courage is...an inspiration... Aye, we will win this war yet, by gods!
